LOHERA Name: Trent Park Stable Block- Address: Snakes Lane, Trent Country Park, Cockfosters- Type: Stables- Local Heritage Asset: The stable block stands on the southern ridge overlooking the mansion, which is a Grade II listed building set in the historic landscape originally designed by Sir Humphrey Repton.  The northern side of the stable block was designed by Sir William Chambe

LOHERA Name: The Dower House- Address: Trent Country Park, Cockfosters- Type: Dwellinghouse- Local Heritage Asset: In 1951, the Trent Park estate was purchased by Middlesex County Council by compulsory purchase order, to preserve the Green Belt. description: Variation of condition 2 of 21/02813/VAR to allow amendments to the Oakwood Lodge and Lyon House (previous Block 1 and 2) 1) Amendments to Oakwood Lodge from 1no. dwelling to 2no. dwellings with associated works; 2) Provision of bus shelter and cycle pavilion to the east of Oakwood Lodge; 3)  Alterations to shuttle bus turning circle layout with associated highway and landscape works; and 4) Relocation of the bus welfare room and shuttle bus garage from Oakwood Lodge to Lyon House to provide 1no. shuttle bus parking space and electric parking point with associated works.
